bill_title: redact certain information from public records that may endanger a person's life or safety.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to redact certain information from public records that may endanger a person's life or safety. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any judge, prosecutor, law enforcement officer, probation officer, parole officer, or correctional officer who claims information disclosed in a public record may endanger the person's life or safety pursuant to subdivision 1-27-1.5(23) may request in writing to the state or any of its political subdivisions to have his or her address or other identifying information removed from a public record. The person shall complete an affidavit stating that he or she meets the criteria of this section and § 1-27-1.5. and shall sign the affidavit under penalty of perjury. The state or the political subdivision shall remove such information from its website and deny access to such information, except by court order. 180 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.052 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
